director.name: Prasanna Jayakody
director.bio:
Prasanna Jayakody

Film Director | Screenwriter | Visual Storyteller

Prasanna Jayakody (born August 25, 1968) is one of Sri Lanka’s most acclaimed contemporary filmmakers and screenwriters, celebrated for his poetic visual language and deep humanism. Educated at Taxila Central College in Horana, Jayakody transitioned from television to cinema, bringing a new cinematic voice defined by introspection, spirituality, and realism. His work often explores inner conflict, moral ambiguity, and the silent spaces of human emotion.

Signature Works

Sankara (2007) – Jayakody’s directorial debut; won the Silver Pyramid Award at the Cairo International Film Festival and the NETPAC Award for Best Asian Film at Kerala IFF.
Karma (2012) – A meditative study of guilt, redemption, and spiritual transcendence; acclaimed for its minimalist narrative.
28 (2014) – A socially charged road drama exploring mortality and class divide through the journey of a dead body.
Leopard Do Not Bite (2015) – A metaphorical reflection on violence and innocence in post-war Sri Lanka.
Dadayakkaraya (2019) – A psychological exploration of solitude and the search for identity.

Television Career

Before his cinematic success, Jayakody directed several award-winning teledramas that shaped his early artistic identity:
Awasana Horawa (The Final Hour, 1998) – won Best Young Director at the Sumathi Tele Awards.
Nisala Vila (The Still Pond, 1999)
Imadiyamankada (At the Crossing, 2000)
Sanda Amawakayi (The Moon Eclipsed, 2002)
Hada Vila Sakmana (2003)

These works established his reputation for capturing silence, atmosphere, and emotional realism.

Awards & Recognition

Silver Pyramid Award – Cairo International Film Festival (2007)

NETPAC Award for Best Asian Film – Kerala International Film Festival (2007)

Jury Special Prize – Turkey Silk Road Film Festival (2007)

Multiple international festival screenings and critical acclaim for 28 and Karma.

Style & Impact

Prasanna Jayakody’s films are marked by:

Minimal dialogue and profound visual storytelling.

Themes of spirituality, morality, and inner conflict.

A blend of realism and poetic metaphor that defines his cinematic signature.

Global recognition as one of Sri Lanka’s leading auteurs in the international film circuit.

Festival Favorites: Titles like Sankara, Karma, and 28 are critically revered and ideal for curated world-cinema selections.

Art House Appeal: Perfect for global viewers seeking spiritual and philosophical cinema from South Asia.

Cultural Depth: Bridges Sri Lankan heritage with modern existential storytelling, enhancing OTT library diversity.

Film Producer | Creative Visionary | Curator of Definitive Sri Lankan Cinema

Rasitha Jinasena is a prominent Sri Lankan film producer known for backing some of the most artistically significant and commercially impactful films of the last decade. His portfolio spans festival hits, critically acclaimed dramas, and youth-driven mainstream cinema. From the spiritual minimalism of Leopard Do Not Bite to the dynamic social narratives of Uthuru Sulanga and Yaaluwoda? Yaaluida?, Jinasena has emerged as a producer with strong artistic instincts and an eye for cinematic storytelling that resonates with both local and global audiences.

With credits across feature films, executive production, and drama, he has helped shape Sri Lanka’s evolving cinematic identity by supporting bold directors, fresh talent, and stories that break away from formula.

Signature Works

Uthuru Sulanga (2023) – Producer
A compelling urban-rural psychological drama; praised for its emotional depth, powerful performances, and atmospheric direction.

Yaaluwoda? Yaaluida? (2023) – Producer
A vibrant youth-oriented film featuring an ensemble cast; blends romance, music, and social commentary.

Whispering Mountains (2023) – Producer
A high-rated atmospheric drama exploring human conflict and spiritual introspection.

A tender and thoughtful drama praised for its visual poetry and narrative subtlety.

A festival-acclaimed art-house film; known for its quiet tension, symbolism, and striking cinematography.

A road-movie-style social drama that explores caste, mortality, and human dignity during a journey with a corpse.

A major historical epic featuring Jackson Anthony and Pooja Umashankar; visually rich and based on Buddhist legend.

A groundbreaking spiritual drama exploring redemption, guilt, and rebirth; praised for its minimalist aesthetic.

Supporting director-driven cinema with strong artistic merit.

castMemberCommonResDTO.bio:
Actor · Stage Performer · Art Director
Sri Lanka · Active since 1978

Mahendra Perera is one of the most influential and versatile actors in Sri Lankan cinema, equally acclaimed for his dramatic depth and comedic timing. With a career spanning over four decades, he has appeared in more than 70 films, numerous television serials and multiple stage productions — becoming a defining screen presence in Sinhala cinema.

Born in Mount Lavinia, Mahendra began exploring music and performance while still in school, later training under legendary theatre masters including Dhamma Jagoda, Dr. Solomon Fonseka and Tony Ranasinghe. His rise began with Sakwithi Suwaya (1978) and Sagarayak Meda (1981), leading to standout roles in landmark films such as Aswesuma, Mille Soya, Bahubuthayo, Kosthapal Punyasoma, Sulanga Enu Pinisa, 28, Gindari and Address Na.

Known for shifting effortlessly between hero, villain, comic relief and character roles, he is one of the few actors to maintain equal success in film, TV and stage. He also worked behind the camera as art director (Julietge Bhumikawa, Pawuru Walalu) and assistant director (Koti Waligaya).

• Award-winning actor at the Sarasaviya Awards and Presidential Film Awards

Legendary Actor | Dramatist | Pioneer of Sri Lankan Television

Daya Bandara Thennakoon (1941–2020) remains one of Sri Lanka’s most respected and influential actors, celebrated for his profound contributions to cinema, stage drama, and television. Renowned for his emotional depth, signature style, and intellectual approach to performance, he built a remarkable career spanning more than five decades. From landmark films like Hanthane Kathawa, Bambaru Awith, Karumakkarayo, and Sakman Maluwa to iconic stage and television work, Thennakoon became a pillar of Sri Lankan performing arts.

A graduate of the University of Ceylon, he first entered the creative world through the guidance of filmmaker Dharmasena Pathiraja and soon evolved into a versatile performer whose characters carried realism, intensity, and quiet power. He was also a radio professional, director, educator, and pioneer of the first-ever Sri Lankan television music video, cementing his legacy as a creative visionary.

Elevated realistic acting in cinema and stage.

Left behind a body of work that continues to shape actors and storytellers across generations.

Daya Thennakoon’s contribution is woven into the cultural fabric of Sri Lankan arts — a legacy of brilliance, discipline, and authenticity.

director.name: Priyantha Colambage
director.bio:
Priyantha Colombage is an award-winning Sri Lankan filmmaker best known for redefining Sinhala cinema with his debut feature Dehena (Trance) in 1998. At just 19, he became the youngest film director in Sri Lankan history. Dehena went on to win the highest number of awards for a Sri Lankan film that year and represented the country at the Tokyo International Film Festival.

His second film Vimukthi (Salvation) was selected unanimously by local critics to represent Sri Lanka at the Kerala, Milwelly and Cairo International Film Festivals, further establishing him as a bold, festival-driven storyteller. His third feature Arumosam Vehi (Fancy Rains) won Best Film at the 9th China International Children’s Film Festival in Ningbo (2007).

Colombage later founded Creative Force, a production company that became a major player in Sri Lankan television, advertising and documentary filmmaking. He has directed high-profile commercials for brands such as Unilever, Nestlé, Lion Breweries and Ceylinco, and produced several popular TV programs, including the political satire puppet show Jabos Lane and the educational children’s series Kekulu Yaya.

His filmography includes Adaraneeya Kathawak (2016), Dedunu Akase (2017), and two new 2024 releases, Mandara and Suriya Sulanga (currently in post-production). Across cinema, television and advertising, Colombage is recognised for visual storytelling rooted in emotion, psychology and human contradiction.

Key highlights
• Youngest film director in Sri Lankan cinema history
• Multi-award winner, screened at Tokyo, Kerala, Cairo, Milwelly and Ningbo festivals
• Acclaimed across feature films, commercials, children’s programming and satire
• Known for cinematic realism, bold themes and festival-oriented narratives

castMemberCommonResDTO.bio:
Hemal Sachindra Ranasinghe is one of Sri Lanka’s most popular and versatile actors, admired for his charisma, talent, and ability to embody a wide range of characters on screen. Born in Matale in 1984, Hemal first gained international attention as a male model, winning Male Model of the World 2009 in Spain, before stepping into cinema. Since his debut in Super Six (2012), he has consistently held the spotlight in Sri Lankan cinema, winning multiple awards for Best Actor, Most Popular Actor, Youth Choice Actor, and Trend Setter.

With a strong presence in both commercial blockbusters and artistic films, Hemal is known for seamlessly blending action, romance, and drama. His background in martial arts and dance enhances his performances, giving him a unique physicality and on-screen energy. He has also extended his talent to television, both as an actor and a reality show judge. Born in Negombo, Udari began her career in modelling, becoming a finalist at Miss Sri Lanka for Miss World 2007, where she won several special titles including Miss Talent, Miss Popular and Beautiful Legs. In 2015, she was crowned Mrs. Sri Lanka for Mrs. Globe, winning additional titles for Elegance, Skin and Popularity.

Before entering acting, she appeared in high-profile commercials and music videos, later making her film debut at age 21 in Paya Enna Hiru Se. Since then, she has worked across cinema, television and presenting, including roles in Adaraneeya Kathawak, Porisadaya, Midunu Vishwaya, Ksheera Sagaraya Kalabina, and the upcoming Devi Kusumasana.

During the COVID-19 lockdown period, she completed filming for eight major feature films, confirming her status as one of the industry’s most in-demand performers.

Career highlights
• Most Popular Actress – Sumathi Awards, Derana, Raigam Tele’es
• Starred in top-rated TV dramas including Bonda Meedum and Sansaranya Asabada
• Crowned Mrs. Sri Lanka for Mrs. Globe 2015
• Known for versatile roles in romance, historical drama, and psychological thrillers
• Strong dual career in cinema and television, with multiple unreleased feature films in pipeline

Signature roles
Sansala (Bonda Meedum)
Piyavi Hansika (Adaraneeya Kathawak)
Sedera Menike (Eka Gei Sokari)
Rajini Madirakshi (Midunu Vishwaya)
Purambhikawa (Ksheera Sagaraya Kalabina)

castMemberCommonResDTO.name: Bimal Jayakody
castMemberCommonResDTO.bio:
Actor · Performer · Producer
Sri Lanka · Active since 1990s

Bimal Jayakody is one of Sri Lankan cinema and television’s most versatile character actors, celebrated for emotionally intense roles and critically acclaimed performances across film, TV and theatre. Known for his ability to shift between heroic, tragic and antagonist roles, he has earned multiple Best Actor awards and festival nominations for films such as Gamani, Sakkarang and Dekala Purudu Kenek.

Born into a family deeply rooted in the performing arts, Bimal entered the industry as a TV technician before transitioning into acting. His extended family includes several iconic Sri Lankan actresses, including Geetha Kanthi Jayakody and Rathna Lalani, making him part of one of the country’s most respected acting dynasties.

He made his film debut in 2006 with Ali Patiyo Oyai Mamai and went on to work in landmark productions including Aba, Siri Parakum, Bambara Walalla, Paya Enna Hiru Se, U Turn, Tsunami, Kawuruth Danne Na, and the internationally acclaimed Dekala Purudu Kenek, for which he won Best Actor at the Sarasaviya Awards.

On television, he has starred in more than 60 series, including Sanakeliyay Maya, Pabalu, Raahu, Deweni Inima, Pani Makuluwo, Veeduru Mal and Sihina Aran Enna, earning wide recognition as a dramatic lead and anti-hero figure. He also released a single, Oba Aye Dawasaka, in 2014, showcasing his parallel music career.

Among his upcoming film roles are major performances in Rani (as Mahinda Rajapaksa), Mandara, Mother Lanka and several unreleased titles in production, confirming his continued relevance in modern Sri Lankan cinema.

Career Highlights
• Multiple Best Actor wins including Raigam Tele’es and Sarasaviya Awards
• Acclaimed for roles in Gamani, Sakkarang and Dekala Purudu Kenek
• Known for intense, layered portrayals in serious drama and psychological conflict
• Actor from a legendary Sri Lankan artistic family lineage
• Over three decades of work across film, television, theatre and music

Signature roles
Major Vikum (Gamani)
Sube (Sakkarang)
Sachithra (Dekala Purudu Kenek)
Inspector Wikrama (Kawuruth Danne Na)
Uvindu (Adaraneeya Kathawak)
Clifford Dunuwila (1970 Love Story)

castMemberCommonResDTO.name: Suranga Ranawaka
castMemberCommonResDTO.bio:
Actor · Director · Screenwriter
Sri Lanka · Active since 2010

Suranga Ranawaka is a Sri Lankan actor and filmmaker best known for his performances in the critically acclaimed war drama Alimankada (2010), the psychological thriller Dirty, Yellow, Darkness (2015), and the 2022 feature Happy Birthday. With a screen presence rooted in realism and emotional restraint, he is recognized for portraying conflicted, complex characters in dark, character-driven cinema.

castMemberCommonResDTO.name: Aruni Rajapaksha
castMemberCommonResDTO.bio:
Actress · Model · TV Host · Beauty Queen
Sri Lanka · Active since 2004

Aruni Rajapaksha is a Sri Lankan actress, model and television host who entered the public spotlight after winning two major pageant titles — Udarata Menike 2004 and Capri Beauty Queen 2005. She later moved into acting, television presenting and brand work, becoming a familiar face across cinema, fashion and entertainment media in Sri Lanka.

She made her film debut in Super Six (2012) as the lead actress, followed by key roles in historical, dramatic and musical films such as Maharaja Gemunu, Address Na, Paththini and Adaraneeya Kathawak. Known for her elegant screen presence, she has appeared in both commercial and period cinema, often portraying graceful, poised and strong female characters.

Alongside acting, Aruni has hosted several popular lifestyle and talk shows including Hello Sri Lanka and Liyasevana, extending her career into television presenting and live entertainment.

Career highlights
• Crowned Udarata Menike (2004) & Capri Beauty Queen (2005)
• Lead actress in Super Six and featured in Maharaja Gemunu, Paththini and Adaraneeya Kathawak
• TV host for multiple programmes on mainstream Sri Lankan television
• Fashion model with national recognition before entering film

Personal
Born in Kalpitiya and raised in Kandy, Aruni transitioned from technical studies to modelling before entering pageantry. She is married to Nalin Samarawickrama and is the mother of twin daughters.

castMemberCommonResDTO.name: Maureen Charuni
castMemberCommonResDTO.bio:
Actress · Director · Veteran Performer
Sri Lanka · Active since 1984

Maureen Charuni is a highly respected Sri Lankan actress known for her long-standing contribution to cinema, theatre and television. With a career spanning four decades, she is recognised as one of the country’s most versatile dramatic performers, especially celebrated for her emotional depth in motherly and family-centric roles. She has become a familiar and beloved presence in Sri Lankan households through some of the most successful and long-running TV serials in the country’s history.

Born in Kurunegala and named after Hollywood star Maureen O’Hara, Charuni entered the industry despite early family opposition, making her cinematic debut in Karadiya Walalla. She later rose to national fame with her performance as Nanda in the iconic teledrama Gamperaliya, followed by major roles in works such as Paba, Sara, Sandagalathenna, Teacher Amma, Aliya, Golu Muhude Kunatuwak and Panamankkada.

In addition to her acting career, she directed the film Hansa Vilapaya in 2000, further solidifying her creative range beyond performance.

Maureen Charuni is widely regarded as a dramatic cornerstone of Sri Lankan television, often cast in emotionally strong, graceful, resilient mother figures that transcend generational storytelling.

Career highlights
• Over 150+ acting credits across film, theatre and television
• Known for iconic performances in Gamperaliya, Thunkal Sihinaya and Maya
• One of Sri Lanka’s most consistent and recognisable character actresses
• Director of the feature film Hansa Vilapaya
• Frequently cast in leading mother roles in major film releases for over 30 years

Personal
A qualified sitar player and English teacher before entering cinema, Charuni is married to tourism professional Gihan Ranjith Imbulana and is the mother of one daughter.

castMemberCommonResDTO.name: Anjalee Liyanage
castMemberCommonResDTO.bio:
Actress · Performer · Public Personality
Sri Lanka · Active in film & television

Anjali Liyanage is a Sri Lankan actress known for her versatile range and captivating on-screen presence. Over the years, she has earned recognition as a reliable and expressive performer, taking on roles that span drama, romance, comedy and family storytelling. Her natural screen charisma and emotional depth have made her a familiar face in both television and cinema.

Beyond acting, Anjali maintains an active digital presence, connecting with audiences through her official social media channels. She uses Instagram (@sl_anjalee_liyanage) to share behind-the-scenes moments, lifestyle posts, production updates and direct interaction with fans, while her Twitter feed highlights industry news and upcoming projects.

Her official website features a detailed biography, portfolio gallery, featured video clips and announcements, showcasing her multi-layered career and ongoing work in the entertainment industry.

Recognised for
• Strong emotional performances across multiple genres
• Consistent presence in Sri Lankan entertainment
• Active engagement with audiences across social platforms

castMemberCommonResDTO.name: Priyantha Colambage
castMemberCommonResDTO.bio:
Priyantha Colombage is an award-winning Sri Lankan filmmaker best known for redefining Sinhala cinema with his debut feature Dehena (Trance) in 1998. At just 19, he became the youngest film director in Sri Lankan history. Dehena went on to win the highest number of awards for a Sri Lankan film that year and represented the country at the Tokyo International Film Festival.

His second film Vimukthi (Salvation) was selected unanimously by local critics to represent Sri Lanka at the Kerala, Milwelly and Cairo International Film Festivals, further establishing him as a bold, festival-driven storyteller. His third feature Arumosam Vehi (Fancy Rains) won Best Film at the 9th China International Children’s Film Festival in Ningbo (2007).

Colombage later founded Creative Force, a production company that became a major player in Sri Lankan television, advertising and documentary filmmaking. He has directed high-profile commercials for brands such as Unilever, Nestlé, Lion Breweries and Ceylinco, and produced several popular TV programs, including the political satire puppet show Jabos Lane and the educational children’s series Kekulu Yaya.

His filmography includes Adaraneeya Kathawak (2016), Dedunu Akase (2017), and two new 2024 releases, Mandara and Suriya Sulanga (currently in post-production). Across cinema, television and advertising, Colombage is recognised for visual storytelling rooted in emotion, psychology and human contradiction.

Key highlights
• Youngest film director in Sri Lankan cinema history
• Multi-award winner, screened at Tokyo, Kerala, Cairo, Milwelly and Ningbo festivals
• Acclaimed across feature films, commercials, children’s programming and satire
• Known for cinematic realism, bold themes and festival-oriented narratives

director.name: Jackson Anthony
director.bio:
Actor · Director · Writer · Cultural Icon
Sri Lanka · 1958 – 2023

Jackson Anthony was one of the greatest and most decorated actors in Sri Lankan cinema, theatre and television, widely honoured as “Sakala Kala Sakwithi” — the King of All Arts. With a career spanning four decades, he redefined the Sri Lankan screen and stage with his unmatched versatility, powerful character work and record-breaking 16 Best Actor awards.

Celebrated for landmark performances in Bawa Duka, Bawa Karma, Sooriya Arana, Aswesuma, Mille Soya and Gini Avi Saha Gini Keli, he moved across drama, history, folklore, thriller and spiritual cinema with equal mastery. His presence extended far beyond acting — he was also a director, screenwriter, lyricist, novelist, historian, presenter, singer and explorer, commanding every medium he stepped into.

As a director, he made some of the most ambitious Sri Lankan films ever produced, including Aba and Address Na. His teledramas like Daskon and See Raja won multiple awards for writing and direction, setting new standards for historical television storytelling.

Jackson Anthony was also a beloved host, documentary traveller and cultural educator, known for shows such as Maha Sinhalaye Vansa Kathawa, Ganga Dige, and Roma Puranaya, blending history, spirituality and national identity.

His legacy lives through an unparalleled body of work, a generation of actors he influenced, and his three children who all followed him into the arts.

Legacy highlights
• Widely regarded as the greatest dramatic actor in Sinhala cinema
• Winner of 16 Best Actor awards — a national record
• Actor, director, presenter, historian, lyricist and cultural educator
• Star of Bawa Duka, Sooriya Arana, Mille Soya, Aswesuma
• Directed major films including Aba, Julietge Bhumikawa and Address Na
• Presenter of landmark travel & heritage programs watched by millions

Remembered as
A multi-disciplinary artist, a scholar in performance, and a national cultural figure whose work transformed Sri Lankan storytelling across every medium.

castMemberCommonResDTO.name: Janitha Marasinghe
castMemberCommonResDTO.bio:
Actor · Television & Film Performer
Sri Lanka · Active since early 2000s

Janitha Marasinghe is a Sri Lankan actor known for his appearances in film and television, most recognised for his roles in the drama Le Kiri Kandulu (2003), the family adventure sequel Ran Kewita 2 (2013) and the political satire film Jayasri Amathithuma (2019). With a screen presence rooted in relatable, grounded character portrayals, he has been part of productions that blend emotional storytelling with social themes.

Active across different genres, Janitha has worked in both mainstream and character-driven roles, earning recognition for subtle, naturalistic acting rather than theatrics. His on-screen work includes drama, comedy and socially reflective cinema, contributing to a growing career in Sri Lankan film.

Known for
• Le Kiri Kandulu – Drama (2003)
• Ran Kewita 2 – Family/Adventure (2013)
• Jayasri Amathithuma – Satire/Comedy (2019)

castMemberCommonResDTO.name: Sabeetha Perera
castMemberCommonResDTO.bio:
Actress · Sri Lankan & Pakistani Cinema Icon
Sri Lanka / Pakistan · Active since 1967

Sabeetha Perera is one of the most successful and influential actresses in Sri Lankan cinema, dominating the 1980s and 1990s as the undisputed female superstar of the era. Known for her expressive performances, screen glamour and ability to carry both commercial and artistic films, she built a cross-border legacy as a major star in both Sinhala cinema and Pakistan’s Lollywood industry.

Born on 1 December 1962 to legendary Sri Lankan film couple Anthony Stanley Perera (director/actor) and Girley Gunawardana (actress), Sabeetha entered cinema at age three, appearing in her parents’ films Iwasana Dana and Hathara Kendare. Her breakthrough as an adult came with Rosy, leading to her first Pakistani film Sadaakal Randeva — released in Urdu as Kabi Al Vidana Kena, a blockbuster in both countries. She went on to star in 17 Urdu films, including Nadiya, Zameen Aur Aasman, Donkaraya, Sabke Baap and Aagh Hi Aagh, earning Best Actress at the Alsakar Film Festival and multiple Pakistani awards including the popular Bobby title and the Al-Shakar Award.

In Sri Lanka, she delivered some of the most iconic female roles in Sinhala cinema, winning Best Actress at the Sarasaviya Awards (1985) for Deveni Gamana and receiving further acclaim for Viragaya (as Bathee) and Sisila Gini Gani (as Annette) — still considered two of the finest female performances ever recorded in Sinhala film.

Across a career spanning five decades, she has acted in over 100 films across Sinhala, Urdu, Tamil and English, including Bangali Walalu, Sakvithi Suwaya, Viragaya, Chandi Raja, Cheriyo Doctor, Oba Koheda Priye, Aba and Address Na. She also appeared in popular teledramas such as Ran Kahawanu, Pitagamkarayo and Akala Sandya, and in the stage play Age Nama Rathi.

Sabeetha has received Sarasaviya, OCIC, Presidential and Swarna Shanka Awards, along with a Special Award from the Pakistan Film Corporation for international contribution to cinema.

Married to businessman Upali Jayasinghe, she remains a celebrated cultural icon whose career bridged two film nations.

Known for
• One of Sri Lanka’s biggest female superstars of the ’80s–’90s
• Acted in 17 Urdu films, making her a rare Sri Lankan crossover star
• Award-winning performances in Deveni Gamana, Viragaya and Sisila Gini Gani
• Winner of Best Actress awards in both Sri Lanka and Pakistan

castMemberCommonResDTO.name: Sheshadrie Priyasad
castMemberCommonResDTO.bio:
Actress · TV Presenter · Former Child Star
Sri Lanka · Active since 1997

Sheshadrie Priyasad is a Sri Lankan actress and television presenter who began her career as a child artist and grew into one of the familiar young faces in modern Sinhala cinema and TV entertainment. Born into a celebrated film family, she is the second daughter of veteran director and producer Dinesh Priyasad, and part of the well-known “Priyasad sisters” trio, alongside actresses Dinakshie and Shanudrie.

She made her screen debut at the age of four in her father’s film Apaye Thathpara Asu Haradahak (1997) and first gained public recognition as a child TV host in the Sirasa TV program Punchi Panchi. Her first major lead role as an adult came in the 2011 youth film Challenges (Yawwanaye Babaru Api), followed by performances in Senasuru Maruwa, Double Trouble, Address Na and Zoom.

For her performance in Zoom, she received a Merit Award at the 34th Sarasaviya Awards (2016) and was also nominated for Best Upcoming Actress the same year. She continues to work in both commercial and youth-oriented cinema, recently starring in Weerya (2024) and Sihinayaki Adare (2024), with several unreleased productions in the pipeline.

Raised and educated at Holy Family Convent, Bambalapitiya, Sheshadrie is known not only for her film work but also for her presence as a presenter, particularly connected to children's and lifestyle television formats.

Known for
• Early child roles and transition into leading actress
• Starring in Challenges, Address Na, Zoom and Weerya
• Member of Sri Lanka’s most famous acting sibling trio
• Active in film, TV hosting and youth entertainment culture

castMemberCommonResDTO.name: Kamal Addararachchi
castMemberCommonResDTO.bio:
Actor · Singer · Presenter · Theatre Performer
Sri Lanka · Active since 1981

Kamal Addararachchi is one of the most recognisable actors in Sri Lankan cinema, theatre and television, known for his intense screen presence, dramatic range and iconic performances across four decades. He made his film debut while still in school, appearing in Gamini Fonseka’s Sagarayak Meda (1981), and went on to become a leading figure in Sinhala cinema through landmark roles in Saptha Kanya, Agnidahaya, Sewwandi, Mille Soya, Gharasarapa and Ginnen Upan Seethala.

A graduate of Wesley College, Colombo, Kamal was active in music, literature and Kandyan dance in his youth, later moving into stage plays, teledramas and film. His breakout performance came with Saptha Kanya (1993), followed by his award-winning role as Sobana in Agnidahaya, which earned him the Sarasaviya Best Actor Award (2002). He has since acted in more than 40 films, 20 teledramas and six major stage productions.

In television, Kamal became a household name not only as an actor but also as the original host of the hit reality series Sirasa Superstar (seasons 1–3) and later Hiru Mega Stars, solidifying his crossover appeal to younger generations.

He is also a playback and pop singer, first entering the music scene with the widely popular duet “Unmadawoo” (1993), still considered one of the most memorable love songs in Sinhala cinema.

Career highlights
• More than 40 feature films and 20+ teledramas since the 1980s
• Winner of Sarasaviya Best Actor, Presidential Award, Sumathi Awards
• Known for Saptha Kanya, Agnidahaya, Mille Soya, Randiya Dahara, Gharasarapa
• Host of Sri Lanka’s most-watched talent show Sirasa Superstar
• Actor, singer, TV presenter and respected theatre performer

Significant roles
Akhil Ruwanwalla (Saptha Kanya)
Sobana (Agnidahaya)
Captain Samantha Weerasuriya (Randiya Dahara)
Sandeares Edirisinghe (Gharasarapa)
Rohana Wijeweera (Ginnen Upan Seethala)

castMemberCommonResDTO.name: Mahendra Perera
castMemberCommonResDTO.bio:
Actor · Stage Performer · Art Director
Sri Lanka · Active since 1978

Mahendra Perera is one of the most influential and versatile actors in Sri Lankan cinema, equally acclaimed for his dramatic depth and comedic timing. With a career spanning over four decades, he has appeared in more than 70 films, numerous television serials and multiple stage productions — becoming a defining screen presence in Sinhala cinema.

Born in Mount Lavinia, Mahendra began exploring music and performance while still in school, later training under legendary theatre masters including Dhamma Jagoda, Dr. Solomon Fonseka and Tony Ranasinghe. His rise began with Sakwithi Suwaya (1978) and Sagarayak Meda (1981), leading to standout roles in landmark films such as Aswesuma, Mille Soya, Bahubuthayo, Kosthapal Punyasoma, Sulanga Enu Pinisa, 28, Gindari and Address Na.

Known for shifting effortlessly between hero, villain, comic relief and character roles, he is one of the few actors to maintain equal success in film, TV and stage. He also worked behind the camera as art director (Julietge Bhumikawa, Pawuru Walalu) and assistant director (Koti Waligaya).

• 40+ years in cinema, theatre and television
• Known for Aswesuma, Bahubuthayo, Mille Soya, Kosthapal Punyasoma, 28
• Award-winning actor at the Sarasaviya Awards and Presidential Film Awards
• Frequently cast by directors Sumitra Peries, Vasantha Obeysekera, Udayakantha Warnasuriya and Jayantha Chandrasiri
• Notable for unforgettable comedic characters like Lanty in Bahubuthayo and Gindari

Berty Malli (Sakwithi Suwaya)

Lanty (Bahubuthayo / Gindari)
Kulatunga (Randiya Dahara)

castMemberCommonResDTO.name: Hemal Ranasinghe
castMemberCommonResDTO.bio:
Hemal Sachindra Ranasinghe is one of Sri Lanka’s most popular and versatile actors, admired for his charisma, talent, and ability to embody a wide range of characters on screen. Born in Matale in 1984, Hemal first gained international attention as a male model, winning Male Model of the World 2009 in Spain, before stepping into cinema. Since his debut in Super Six (2012), he has consistently held the spotlight in Sri Lankan cinema, winning multiple awards for Best Actor, Most Popular Actor, Youth Choice Actor, and Trend Setter.

With a strong presence in both commercial blockbusters and artistic films, Hemal is known for seamlessly blending action, romance, and drama. His background in martial arts and dance enhances his performances, giving him a unique physicality and on-screen energy. He has also extended his talent to television, both as an actor and a reality show judge. Today, Hemal is recognized as a leading figure of contemporary Sri Lankan cinema, with a career that continues to expand both locally and internationally.

Signature Works on OTT

Super Six (2012) – Debut role, introducing him to cinema audiences

Pravegaya (2015) – Critically acclaimed, earned Jury and Popular awards

Adaraneeya Kathawak (2016) – Romantic drama showcasing emotional depth

Zoom (2016) – Contemporary role blending technology and relationships

Bandhanaya (2017) – Historical-horror role as Jayasoma

Thaala (2019) – Role as Asela in a musical drama about identity and passion

Vijayaba Kollaya (2019) – Historical drama, nominated for Best Actor

Colombo (2021) – Played Oscar in an urban crime drama

Ksheera Sagaraya Kalabina (2023) – Historical fantasy, nominated for Best Supporting Actor

Sihinayaki Adare (2024) – Contemporary romance as Rehan

1970 Love Story (2024) – Retro romance as Raveen

Sihina Nelum Mal (2024) – Won Best Actor in a Leading Role

Ice Cream (2025) – Upcoming role as Dudu

Devi Kusumasana (2025) – Historical portrayal of Konappu Bandara

Maria (TBA) – Lead role Anthony, won international Best Actor award at HANIFF

The Wife, Maaya Bonchi (ElephantPass), Swans by the Sea, The Hidden City – Upcoming OTT-ready titles

Television Roles

Eelangata Mokada Wenne (2014–2015) – Only teledrama role, won Best Supporting Actor at the Rupavahini State Awards.

Hosted Ayemath Adaren on Hiru TV.

Judge on Hiru Super Dancer reality competition.

Awards & Accolades

Derana Film Awards – Most Popular Actor (2016, 2018), Critic Award (2016), Best Actor (2025).

Hiru Golden Film Awards – Most Promising Actor (2016), Trend Setter (2018).

Sarasaviya Awards – Jury Award (2016), Best Actor nominations for Pravegaya and Vijayaba Kollaya.

Presidential Film Awards – Best Upcoming Actor (Pravegaya, 2017), Special Jury Award (2023).

SLIM People’s Awards – Multiple wins as Actor of the Year and Youth Choice Actor (2018–2025).

Signis Awards – Best Actor nomination for Adaraneeya Kathawak.

HANIFF (Hanoi International Film Festival 2022) – Best Leading Actor (Maria).

Style & Impact

Hemal Ranasinghe is admired for:

Charismatic on-screen presence and physical performance rooted in martial arts and modeling.

Balancing mainstream popularity with award-winning performances.

Establishing himself as a consistent audience favorite across cinema and television.

Bringing contemporary star power while contributing to Sri Lanka’s growing international cinematic identity.

Versatile Filmography: Action (Pravegaya), Romance (Dedunu Akase), Historical (Vijayaba Kollaya), Thriller (U Turn), and Fantasy (Ksheera Sagaraya Kalabina).

Cross-Market Appeal: International recognition through Maria positions him as a Sri Lankan actor with global potential.

Consistent Popularity: His repeated wins in People’s Choice and Youth Awards prove his strong fan base, crucial for digital streaming traction.

Upcoming Slate: With multiple projects set for release in 2025 and beyond, Hemal remains one of the most bankable OTT faces in Sri Lanka.

castMemberCommonResDTO.name: Madhavee Wathsala Anthony
castMemberCommonResDTO.bio:
Actress · Singer · TV Host · Dancer
Sri Lanka · Active since 1994

Madhavee Wathsala Anthony is a multifaceted Sri Lankan performer who entered the industry as a child star through the iconic musical program Hapan Padura and went on to build a career that spans acting, singing, television hosting, music videos, documentaries, and live performance. She is the eldest daughter of legendary actor-director Jackson Anthony and singer-actress Kumari Munasinghe, and is widely recognized as one of the strongest second-generation talents in Sri Lankan entertainment.

A graduate in Archaeology from the University of Kelaniya, Madhavee balances academic depth with artistic range. She has starred in critically acclaimed television dramas including Daskon, See Raja, Pali, Mahaviru Pandu, Thaadi, Amalia and Chandi Kumarihami, earning awards for both acting and playback singing. Her breakthrough in cinema came with the film Address Na, where she appeared opposite her father under his direction.

As a singer, she has recorded hit singles such as Oba Epa, Piyambamee, Raththarane, and Adare Onakere, in addition to performing theme songs for multiple television series. She is also a presenter on Hiru TV and a former child radio host on SLBC and Savana FM.

Career highlights
• Debuted at age 6; trained in music, dance & screen performance
• Known for roles in Daskon, See Raja, Pali, Mahaviru Pandu, Thaadi
• Best Upcoming Actress – Raigam Tele'es
• Merit Awards – Sumathi Awards & National Tele Awards
• Featured in the Raffealla Fernando Celebrity Calendar (2021)
• Playback singer for Eka Gei Sokari and multiple teledrama themes
• Former curator & researcher at Sigiriya Museum and SAARC Cultural Centre
• Lecturer in Tourism & Hospitality (MSU)

Signature screen roles
Palingu Achchi (Daskon)
Subhadra (See Raja)
Pramuditha (Amalia)
Madara (Thaadi)
Janaki (Address Na)

Darshan Dharmaraj was one of the most compelling screen actors of his generation, celebrated for his intense, deeply internalised performances across both Sinhala and Tamil cinema. Born in Rakwana and educated at St. John’s Tamil College, he entered the industry in 2008 through the television serial A9, learning Sinhala from scratch in just three months — a testament to his discipline and artistic curiosity.

His breakthrough came with Ini Avan (2012), where he portrayed a former LTTE cadre with extraordinary emotional restraint and physical realism. The role earned him multiple Best Actor awards, including the Derana Lux Film Award (2013) and the Hiru Golden Film Award (2014), cementing his status as a leading dramatic actor in Sri Lankan cinema.

Dharmaraj’s filmography spans socio-political dramas, commercial cinema and arthouse storytelling, in titles such as Prabhakaran, Matha, Address Na, Aloko Udapadi, House of My Fathers, Bhavatharana and Tsunami. He was equally acclaimed on stage and television, noted for his ability to shift between languages, character types and psychological registers with remarkable authenticity.

Darshan Dharmaraj passed away on 2 October 2022 at the age of 41, leaving behind a legacy of groundbreaking roles that expanded the representation of Tamil characters and post-war narratives in Sri Lankan cinema.

Wasantha Chandrawansa Wittachchi was a legendary figure in Sri Lankan performing arts, celebrated not only as a character actor but as one of the most influential makeup artists in the history of Sinhala stage, cinema and television. Over a four-decade career, he became the only makeup artist in the country to win national awards across all three mediums, while also building a respected body of acting roles in teledramas and feature films.

Born in Colombo and trained under the great dramatists of the Lionel Wendt era, Wittachchi entered theatre in the late 1970s and quickly evolved from performer to master craftsman, learning under icons such as Shesha Palihakkara. His makeup work defined the visual language of landmark productions including Sihina Deshayen, Uppalawanna, Kusa Paba, Mille Soya, Aba and Vijaya Kuweni, while his acting roles in Bumuthurunu, Dandubasnāmānaya, Arungal, Address Na, Paththini and Gharasarapa earned him a loyal following on screen.

A revered teacher and mentor at Tower Hall, Sripalee and the Youth Service Council, Wittachchi trained multiple generations of actors and makeup designers, shaping the aesthetic of modern Sri Lankan theatre. He passed away in February 2025, leaving behind a legacy of innovation, discipline and artistic generosity.

director.name: Asoka Handagama
director.bio:
Writer · Director · Playwright · Television Creator
One of Sri Lanka’s most provocative and internationally acclaimed filmmakers

Asoka Handagama is regarded as a revolutionary voice in Sri Lankan cinema, known for bold storytelling that challenges politics, gender, war, and social morality. Trained in mathematics (BSc First Class – University of Kelaniya) and Development Economics (MSc – University of Warwick), Handagama combines intellectual precision with cinematic risk-taking. Beyond film, he is also an Assistant Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka, making him one of the few global filmmakers who operates between the worlds of art, policy, and economics.

Beginning in theatre, Handagama won national awards for direction before moving into television, where he redefined the Sri Lankan tele-series form with Dunhinda Addara and Synthetic Sihina. His films – including Me Mage Sandai, Flying with One Wing, Ini Avan, and the banned cult classic Aksharaya – have screened at Cannes, San Sebastian, Tokyo, Toronto, and more than 50 international festivals, winning global acclaim and igniting local controversy.

His 2012 film Ini Avan premiered at Cannes (ACID selection), while Flying with One Wing won Best Asian Film at the Tokyo International Film Festival. Aksharaya, banned in Sri Lanka, became one of the most-watched Sri Lankan films online, crossing 3 million views.

Pabudi Kaveesha is a rising Sri Lankan dancer who captured national attention from an early age through her expressive performances, technical skill, and charismatic stage presence. She first became a household name when she won the Under-8 Dancing Title at Derana Little Star in 2014. Her popularity continued to soar, earning her the “Popular Star” title in the show’s 6th season.

In 2022, she elevated her status even further as a finalist in "Sri Lanka’s Best Dancer", showcasing her growth from a child prodigy into a refined young performer with strong artistic identity. Known online as @pabuu_shenali on Instagram, she frequently shares dance clips, rehearsals, and lifestyle content with an expanding fan base.

castMemberCommonResDTO.bio:
Actor | TV Presenter | Commercial Model | Dancer

Deshitha Kawinda Peiris is an emerging Sri Lankan actor and media personality recognized for his charismatic screen presence, versatility, and rising influence across television and digital media. With experience spanning acting, presenting, modelling, and dance, he has quickly positioned himself as a multi-talented performer in the entertainment industry.

He is widely known for his roles in popular teledramas such as “Man Adarei” and “Nikini Kusum,” where he continues to earn attention for his expressive acting and relatable character portrayals. Alongside his screen work, Deshitha is active as a commercial model, collaborating with brands for promotional campaigns, photoshoots, and advertising projects.

Balancing his creative career with academic excellence, he is currently pursuing a BA (Hons) Degree in Film and Television Studies at the University of Kelaniya, sharpening his craft with professional training, production knowledge, and industry-oriented study.

In addition to performing, Deshitha also works behind the camera as the Owner, Editor, and Director at his own creative label, continually expanding his skill set within film and media production.

castMemberCommonResDTO.name: Gihansi Dulanya
castMemberCommonResDTO.bio:
Singer | Reality TV Performer | Emerging Young Talent

Gihansi Dulanya is a rising young Sri Lankan singer who gained national attention through her standout performances on Derana Little Star Season 11. With a natural gift for melody, confidence on stage, and an expressive singing style well beyond her age, she quickly became one of the most loved contestants of the season.

Her performances, including popular renditions such as “Mata Bombay Dilhi”, have gone viral across YouTube and social media, further boosting her presence among young audiences. Gihansi has also taken part in competitive segments like “Little Titans”, showcasing her versatility, agility in performance, and ability to handle challenging musical pieces live.

As her fanbase continues to grow, Gihansi is emerging as a bright young star in Sri Lanka’s next generation of performers, with strong potential to expand into professional music, television, and digital entertainment.
